stories.title: Photosynthesis Adventure
stories.summary: Join Mr. Chloro as he teaches how plants make food using sunlight, water, and air!

panels.narration: The leaf glows softly as Mr. Chloro pops in with a cheerful smile. He loves showing kids the secret life of plants! Mr. Chloro: "Ready for a leaf adventure?" Child: "Whoa… plants can do THAT?"
Sunbeams dance across the leaf like tiny golden helpers. Mr. Chloro shows how plants catch this magical light. Mr. Chloro: "Sunlight is step one!" Child: "It's shining right on us!"
Under the soil, glowing drops of water travel from roots up the stem—like a secret elevator delivering a drink to every leaf. Mr. Chloro: "Roots sip water!" Child: "They DRINK? That's cool!"
Tiny CO₂ bubbles drift into small openings called stomata. It's the plant's way of "breathing" the air around us. Mr. Chloro: "Leaves breathe too!" Child: "Those tiny doors move?!"
Inside the leaf, sunlight, water, and CO₂ swirl together in a bright green spiral. This is photosynthesis—the plant's superpower! Mr. Chloro: "Mix and swirl!" Child: "It looks like magic!"
The leaf makes sweet plant food (sugar!) and releases fresh oxygen into the air—the same oxygen we breathe every day. Mr. Chloro: "Sugar for the plant!" Child: "And oxygen for US!"

stories.title: Mystery on the Moon
stories.summary: Join Luna and her robot friend Nova as they investigate strange moonlight signals coming from the silent crater.

panels.narration: Luna's moon rover screeched to a stop beside a crater glowing neon blue.
panels.ctaLabel: Ask Nova why the crater glows

panels.narration: Nova scanned the air. "No atmosphere, but the glow matches solar flare energy!"
A cluster of smart crystals pulsed in patterns, like they were speaking to Luna.
Using her glove computer, Luna translated the light into musical notes.
The crystals revealed a map to hidden ice tunnels deep under the crater.
Luna marked the discovery and sent a victory pulse back to Earth.

stories.title: Native American Civilizations
stories.summary: Discover the amazing civilizations of Native Americans who lived in North America thousands of years before European settlers arrived!

panels.narration: Long ago, before cities and cars, Native American tribes built incredible civilizations across North America. They lived in harmony with nature and created amazing art, tools, and stories. Guide: "Welcome to ancient America!" Child: "Wow, this is so long ago!"

The Anasazi people built amazing cliff dwellings in the Southwest. They carved homes into mountainsides and created beautiful pottery! Guide: "Look at these incredible homes!" Child: "They lived in cliffs? That's amazing!"
panels.ctaLabel: How did they build cliff dwellings?

panels.narration: The Iroquois Confederacy created one of the first democracies in America! Five tribes worked together to make decisions and keep peace. Guide: "They had their own government!" Child: "Like our country today?"

Native Americans were expert farmers! They grew corn, beans, and squash together—called the "Three Sisters." These plants helped each other grow! Guide: "Smart farming!" Child: "Plants can help each other?"
panels.ctaLabel: How do the Three Sisters work together?

panels.narration: They created beautiful art, stories, and ceremonies that celebrated nature and their connection to the land. Their wisdom and traditions are still honored today! Guide: "Their culture is rich and beautiful!" Child: "I want to learn more!"

stories.title: Early American Settlers
stories.summary: Journey back to the 1600s and discover how the first European settlers built new lives in America!

panels.narration: In 1620, brave families sailed across the ocean on the Mayflower to start a new life in America. They were called Pilgrims and wanted freedom to practice their religion. Guide: "A long and dangerous journey!" Child: "They sailed for months?"
panels.ctaLabel: Why did the Pilgrims come to America?

panels.narration: When they arrived, they met Native Americans who helped them learn to grow food and survive the harsh winters. Together, they celebrated the first Thanksgiving! Guide: "Friendship and cooperation!" Child: "That's where Thanksgiving comes from!"
panels.ctaLabel: What was the first Thanksgiving like?

panels.narration: The settlers built homes, schools, and communities. They worked hard to create a new society based on freedom and self-government. Guide: "Building a new nation!" Child: "They were so brave!"
panels.ctaLabel: How did they build their communities?

panels.narration: Life was tough! They had to grow their own food, make their own clothes, and build everything by hand. But they were determined and creative! Guide: "Hard work and determination!" Child: "They were so resourceful!"
panels.ctaLabel: How did they make everything themselves?

stories.title: The Indus Valley Civilization
stories.summary: Explore one of the world's oldest and most advanced ancient civilizations that thrived in India over 4,000 years ago!

panels.narration: Over 4,000 years ago, a brilliant civilization flourished along the Indus River in ancient India. They built amazing cities with streets, houses, and even bathrooms! Guide: "Welcome to ancient India!" Child: "They had bathrooms back then?"

Their cities were incredibly well-planned! Streets were laid out in a grid pattern, and they had advanced drainage systems to keep cities clean. Guide: "Amazing city planning!" Child: "They were so smart!"
panels.ctaLabel: How did they plan their cities?

panels.narration: They were expert traders! They made beautiful jewelry, pottery, and seals that they traded with people far away. Their writing system is still being decoded by scientists today! Guide: "Mysterious writing!" Child: "Can we read it?"
They were skilled farmers who grew wheat, barley, and cotton. They also raised animals and created beautiful art! Guide: "Farming and creativity!" Child: "They did so many things!"

The Indus Valley Civilization shows us how advanced ancient people were! Their achievements in city planning, trade, and culture inspire us even today. Guide: "A legacy of innovation!" Child: "I want to learn more!"

stories.title: Ancient Indian Kingdoms
stories.summary: Discover the magnificent kingdoms of ancient India with their grand palaces, wise rulers, and rich culture!

panels.narration: Ancient India was home to powerful kingdoms ruled by wise kings and queens. They built magnificent palaces, temples, and cities that still amaze us today! Guide: "Welcome to ancient kingdoms!" Child: "Like in fairy tales?"

The Mauryan Empire was one of the largest and most powerful! Emperor Ashoka was known for his wisdom and kindness. He spread messages of peace carved on stone pillars. Guide: "A wise and kind ruler!" Child: "He wrote on stones?"

Ancient Indian kingdoms were centers of learning! They built universities where students from all over the world came to study mathematics, science, medicine, and philosophy. Guide: "Great centers of knowledge!" Child: "People traveled to learn?"
panels.ctaLabel: What did they teach in ancient universities?

panels.narration: They created beautiful art, music, and dance! Ancient Indian culture included amazing temples with intricate carvings, classical music, and dance forms that are still performed today! Guide: "Rich and beautiful culture!" Child: "I want to see the temples!"
panels.ctaLabel: What are ancient Indian temples like?

panels.narration: Ancient Indian kingdoms made incredible contributions to the world! They invented the number zero, created the decimal system, and wrote amazing stories and poems that are still loved today! Guide: "So many contributions!" Child: "They invented zero?"

The legacy of ancient Indian kingdoms lives on! Their achievements in science, art, and culture continue to inspire people around the world even today. Guide: "A lasting legacy!" Child: "I want to learn more about India!"
panels.ctaLabel: What else did ancient India contribute?
